title: Public transport for the ODI series Australia v Pakistan: Monday 4 November 2024
articleContent:
It's time for the international cricket at the “G”! Public transport is your best way to enjoy this, as Australia takes on Pakistan in the One Day International Series. Extra services will help you get to and from the MCG on Monday 4 November 2024.

The event will begin at 2.30pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Metro Trains Additional services after the game.

Extra return train service from Jolimont Station

  • Mernda – leaving at 10:32pm and 10:52 from Platform 2
  • Greensborough – leaving at 10:39pm and 10:49pm from Platform 2
  • Flinders Street – leaving at 10:29pm and 10:39pm from Platform 1

Extra return train service from Richmond Station

  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:32pm and 10:50pm from Platform 10
  • Blackburn – leaving at 10:36pm and 10:55pm from Platform 9
  • Cheltenham – leaving at 10:32pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 10:34pm and 10:54pm from Platform 2
  • Dandenong – leaving at 10:41pm and 11:01pm from Platform
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:50pm from Platform 4

Extra return train service from Flinders Street

  • Watergardens – leaving at 10:51pm from Platform 4
  • Newport – leaving at 10:58pm from Platform 9
  • Craigieburn – leaving at 10:57pm from Platform 4

Belgrave and Lilydale lines (Ringwood Group): Passengers are adviced to board Blackburn services from Richmond (Platforms 9 or 10), then change at Blackburn for a bus replacement service.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the MCG.

Route 70

  • Extra trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Route 75

  • Extra trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 12 Simpson Street/ Wellington Parade.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from the MCG

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246 (please note services may terminate prior to the end of the match)

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Extra Regional trains from Southern Cross Station

  • Southern Cross to Wyndham Vale – departing at 11:25pm
  • Southern Cross to Wyndham Vale – departing at 11:40p

Additional capacity

  • Southern Cross to Waurn Ponds (Geelong) departing 11.30pm
